title: Yanchen Jiang (Jeff Jiang)
text:
Hello! My name is Yanchen Jiang (I also use the name Jeff Jiang).
I’m a second year Computer Science PhD candidate at Harvard University, advised by Professor David Parkes and Professor Yiling Chen. My research interests lie in leveraging machine learning to study EconCS, decision-making, and multi-agent AI.
I obtained my Bachelor’s degree from Harvard College in 2022, with a major (joint concentration) in Computer Science and Mathematics and a minor (secondary) in Statistics.
I have been the Head TA of Harvard’s CS136: Economics and Computation in Fall 2023, and a TA for the same course (CS136) in Fall 2021.
You can find more information about current projects I’m working on and prior academic publications on the Publications & Projects page and my contact information.

title: Contact Information
text:
Yanchen (Jeff) Jiang

The best way to contact me is at the email address above.

title: Publications & Projects
text:
Academic Publications
* indicates equal contribution.
1. GemNet: Menu-Based, Strategy-Proof Multi-Bidder Auctions Through Deep Learning  Tonghan Wang*, Yanchen Jiang* , David C. Parkes. Accepted at the Twenty-Fifth ACM Conference on Economics and Computation (EC’24), Preprint.   Won Exemplary Paper Award in AI track (presented at the Best EC 24 papers plenary session). 
2. Data Market Design through Deep Learning  Sai Srivatsa Ravindranath*, Yanchen Jiang* , David C. Parkes. Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 36 (NeurIPS 2023). Publication, Preprint.
